revised_title: Fermi Surface and De Haas-van Alphen Effect in Ordered Brass Alloys
tldr: The authors studied the Fermi surface and the de Haas-van Alphen effect in three ordered brass alloys: /?'-CuZn, /?'-AgZn, and /?'-PdIn. They used the pulsed field method to measure the effect and found a remarkable similarity between the Fermi surfaces of AgZn and PdIn. The results also showed good agreement with band structure calculations on CuZn and AgZn. The Fermi surface consists of a hole sheet in the first band and a multiply connected electron sheet in the second band.
